roleset.name: mix with a circular motion
roleset.note: STIR-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Member of Vncls shake-22.3-1-1. (from stir.01-v)

example.name: all args, why?
example.text: John stirred the cake batter with his foot.

roleset.name: cause (emotional) reaction
roleset.note: STIR-V NOTES: Member of Vncls amuse-31.1. (from stir.02-v)

example.name: passivized with instrument
example.text: John-1 was sorely stirred *trace*-1 by Mary's offer of freshly-baked apple pie.
example.arg: by Mary's offer of freshly-baked apple pie

example.name: induced action
example.text: Sterling's firm tone, combined with a steady opening on Wall Street, also stirred some investors to come back to the market, dealers said.
example.arg: Sterling's firm tone, combined with a steady opening on Wall Street,
to come back to the market

roleset.name: move, rouse, awaken
roleset.note: STIR-V NOTES: Member of Vncls modes_of_being_with_motion-47.3. Updated by Julia, 11/2010. (from stir.03-v)

example.name: more or less
example.text: ...while we all waited for the bed lump to stir into song.

example.name: transitive
example.text: [Sotheby's, the auction house founded in London 1744 and now under the umbrella of Sotheby's Holdings Inc.,]-1 was hoping *trace*-1 to stir up interest in old masters as it strove to build its U.S. business.
example.arg: as it strove to build its U.S. business
